DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Area Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm to the Brain First Diagnosis Local-Regional Recurrent Disease Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date related to the first diagnosed or identified recurrence or regrowth of a neoplasm that has spread from a primary site to the brain restricted to the same part or area of the brain which was the surgical bed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Area Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm to the Brain First Diagnosis Local-Regional Recurrent Disease
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the first diagnosed or identified recurrence or regrowth of a neoplasm that has spread from a primary site to the brain restricted to the same part or area of the brain which was the surgical bed.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Area Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm to the Brain
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Area is the the extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.:The spread of a neoplasm from a primary site to the brain. The most common primary tumors metastatic to brain include lung cancer(adenosquamous and small cell especially), breast cancer, melanoma, renal cancer and colon cancer. Metastases are frequently found at the grey/white junction. They are usually well demarcated from the brain parenchyma. The majority of metastases (greater than 75%) are found supratentorially with the minority (less than 10%) found in the brainstem. The patients present with signs and symptoms referable to either increased intracranial pressure or focal pathology. A contrast enhanced MRI will give the best view of suspected metastatic cancers. Therapy for the metastatic cancer is based upon the therapy that would be or has been given to the primary cancer. In any event corticosteroids can be useful for reduction of patients' symptoms. (Kaye, Laws Brain Tumors Churchill Livingstone 1995)

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
The extent of a 2-dimensional surface enclosed within a boundary.

Concepts.longName: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Brain
Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm that has spread to the brain from another anatomic site or system. The majority are carcinomas (usually lung or breast carcinomas).

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Local-Regional; affecting only a restricted part or area of the body.:the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
Of or belonging to both a local and regional area of the body.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
